Maven-Antenna Properties René Müller
maven.antenna.midlet.configuration = CLDC-1.0 maven.antenna.midlet.profile = MIDP-2.0 maven.antenna.preverify = true maven.antenna.obfuscate = true
Property name Optional? Description
maven.antenna.midlet.configuration Yes
Sets the configuration in the MANIFEST.MF. Use either CLDC-1.0 or CLDC-1.1 (default: none, i.e. CLDC version is not set explicitely in MANIFEST.MF of the JAR). Warning: If this property is not set correctly the MIDlet will not work on the mobile devices!
maven.antenna.midlet.profile Yes
Sets the MIDP profile version in the MANIFEST.MF. Use either MIDP-1.0 or MIDP-2.0 (default none, i.e. MIDP version is not set explicitely in MANIFEST.MF of the JAR). Warning: If this property is not set correctly the MIDlet will not work on the mobile devices!
maven.antenna.preverify Yes
If set to true the compiled classes will be processed by the Preverifier. (default: true) Warning: Non-preverified classes cannot be run on mobile devices!>
maven.antenna.obfuscate Yes
If set to true the Proguard obfuscator will process the compiled class files. This will reduce the footprint size of the JAR archive and make revers-engineering, i.e. decompiling of the class files more difficult. (default: false)
antenna.wtk.home No
Path to the location of the Wireless Toolkit home directory. This tool is used by Antenna when starting the device emulator, thus its location must be specified if the simulator should be lauchned as a maven goal.
maven.antenna.simulator.device No
Device that should be used when running the emulator. If none is selected the DefaultColorPhone device will be used.
maven.antenna.simulator.heapsize No
Determines the heap space available to the MIDlet suite. May be something like "65536", "128K" or "1M". Defaults to the latter.
maven.antenna.simulator.trace No
Specifies whether the emulator should display verbose information on the MIDlet in execution. This is basically a comma-separated list of items whose possible values seem to depend on the WTK version (default: none). Options for WTK2.1 are:
allocation
gc
class
verifier
stackmaps
bytecodes
calls
frames
exceptions
events
threading
monitors
networking
all - all of the above
